resources.string: MyFitness App
Expand/Collapse
Do 3 sets of 15 squats.
Squats help to build leg muscles including quadriceps, hamstrings, and calves.
Perform 3 sets of 12 push-ups.
Push-ups work the chest, shoulders, and triceps.
Complete 2 sets of 10 lunges on each leg.
Lunges target the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.
Hold a plank for 1 minute.
Planks strengthen the core, shoulders, and hips.
Do 3 sets of 30 jumping jacks.
Jumping jacks are a good cardio exercise and work multiple muscle groups.
Complete 2 sets of 10 burpees.
Burpees are a full-body exercise that improve strength and aerobic endurance.
Do 3 sets of 15 sit-ups.
Sit-ups primarily target the abdominal muscles and the obliques.
Perform mountain climbers for 1 minute.
Mountain climbers work several different muscles including the deltoids, biceps, triceps, chest, obliques, abdominals, quads, hamstrings, and hips.
Complete 3 sets of 10 leg raises.
Leg raises help to strengthen the abs and the hip flexors.
Run in place with high knees for 2 minutes.
High knees improve coordination, strengthen the leg muscles, and increase your heart rate.
Do 3 sets of 20 Russian twists.
Russian twists target the abdominal muscles, specifically the obliques, and also engage the lower back.
Perform 3 sets of 12 tricep dips.
Tricep dips target the triceps, along with the shoulders, chest, and back.
Hold a side plank for 30 seconds on each side.
Side planks strengthen the obliques, shoulders, and legs.
Do 2 sets of 1-minute arm circles.
Arm circles are a great way to strengthen and tone the shoulders and arms.
Perform 3 sets of 20 flutter kicks.
Flutter kicks are a challenging core exercise that targets the lower abdominal muscles.
Complete 3 sets of 10 box jumps.
Box jumps are a plyometric exercise that improves strength, speed, and cardiovascular health.
Do 3 sets of 15 bicycle crunches.
Bicycle crunches engage the abs, obliques, and hip flexors, and are great for building core strength.
Perform 2 sets of 15 step-ups for each leg.
Step-ups strengthen the legs and glutes, and can improve balance and coordination.
Complete 3 sets of 10 squat jumps.
Squat jumps increase your explosive power, improve upper and lower body strength, and burn calories.
Do 4 sets of 20 calf raises.
Calf raises target the calf muscles, helping to improve ankle stability and leg strength.
Perform 3 sets of 15 glute bridges.
Glute bridges are effective for building lower body strength and activating the glutes and hamstrings.
Do 3 sets of 15 supermans.
Supermans strengthen the back, glutes, and hamstrings, and can help improve posture.
Hold a wall sit for 2 minutes.
Wall sits are an isometric exercise for building strength and endurance in the glutes, calves, quadriceps, hamstrings, and core.
Complete 3 sets of 20 crunches.
Crunches are a classic core exercise that primarily work the rectus abdominis muscle.
Do 2 sets of 15 back extensions.
Back extensions are a lower back exercise that improves the strength and stability of the spine.
Perform as many pull-ups as you can in 2 sets.
Pull-ups are a compound upper-body exercise that improve strength in the back, shoulders, and arms.
Do as many chin-ups as you can in 2 sets.
Chin-ups primarily work the biceps, back muscles, and shoulders.
Complete 3 sets of 15 skater jumps.
Skater jumps are a plyometric exercise that targets the legs and glutes, and improves lateral movement and balance.
Do 3 sets of 10 tuck jumps.
Tuck jumps are a high-intensity exercise that improve strength and power in the lower body.
Spend 15 minutes stretching.
Stretching can help improve flexibility and reduce muscle tightness and soreness.
